weekly_top_story.headline: Japan appoints Sanae Takaichi as first female Prime Minister, signaling possible hard-right turn
weekly_top_story.summary: Japan has appointed Sanae Takaichi as its first female Prime Minister, with expectations that her government will steer the country towards a more hard-right nationalist stance, reshaping Japan’s domestic and foreign policy direction.

stories.headline: Israel and Hamas agree to exchange dead hostages and prisoners as part of Gaza ceasefire deal, but process faces challenges
stories.summary: Israel and Hamas have agreed to exchange remains of hostages and prisoners under the ongoing ceasefire, but mounting accusations and logistical issues threaten to derail the fragile progress toward peace.

stories.headline: Pressure grows on Israel to allow more aid into Gaza as ceasefire holds
stories.summary: International pressure is increasing on Israel to permit greater humanitarian aid into Gaza, where the ceasefire remains in place but access to essential supplies for civilians remains severely restricted.

stories.headline: Stellantis abandons plans to reopen Ontario plant, shifts Jeep Compass production to U.S., raising concerns for Canadian auto sector
stories.summary: Stellantis has canceled plans to reopen its Brampton, Ontario plant and will move Jeep Compass manufacturing to the U.S., a decision that could have significant implications for Canada’s automotive industry and employment.
